author: rkeithhill
body:
Fix #4174

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: I went with that approach first but with the catch statement it seemed to read better with `try/catch/finally` than `try {using()} / catch`.  That said, I can certainly remove the finally and put a `using` statement inside the `try`.  It's about six of one / half dozen the other.  :-)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @rkeithhill looking at the entire file, keeping it try...finally is probably more consistent with other try...catch usage in this file, so LGTM

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Sure would be nice to get this fix into beta.4.  Got some Plaster users on Linux who are hitting this bug.

title: Close FileStream opened to read file go get hash.
